page.title: 18Leaden Roding Police 1
page.content: The Police Station in Leaden Roding has been open since 1952. The function of the police is to get to know the local people and to deal with any local emergency, if it arises. There is no official opening time. If the P.C. is at home then he will deal with the problems. The P.C. has a Panda car and he also walks the beat. The area covered includes, Leaden Roding, White Roding, High Roding, Aythorpe Roding, Margaret Roding, Pleshy, Barnston, and High Easter, a total of 12 square miles. Since January 1985 there have been 30 different types of crimes. In the Summer burglaries are more common, however in the Winter, farms have to be watched more closely, to stop the theft of Christmas livestock eg turkeys, chickens and geese. On average there are 1 to 4 phone calls per day for the P.C. to deal with.
